hanzi-su-wiki:
帯

Значения

Пояс; носить, нести, иметь; зона, пояс, район

Мнемоника

Парадный матерчатый 巾 пояс 冖 вельможи. Вверху — пряжка.

Варианты

帶, 带
purpleculture_pinyin:
dài
Japanese variant of 带
Японский вариант группы
rtega_mnemonic:
帯帯RSsash, belt, obi, zone, region
  • leather 廿廿 implement worn over a tunic 冖 with a stick 巾 to fix the length; bottom looks like the fixing part of a belt
heisig_story: The part of the apron where one finds the buckle (represented pictorially by the first 5 strokes) is on the sash.
myStory: мир или 30 лет или поколение, лоб, полотенце
koohiiStory1: First, note that the top half of the kanji consists of one and mountain. Of course, the "number 1" mountain in Japan is Mt. Fuji. The bottom half, under Mt. Fuji, consists of crown and towel. Now for the story. Archaeologists digging under Mt. Fuji (Japan´s #1 mountain) in an ancient royal tomb (they know it´s royal because of the crown) discover what looks like a towel, but after they clean it up, they see it is actually a splendid royal sash for the king´s kimono.
koohiiStory2: Beautiful "Miss Housewife Japan" is on posters everywhere, cooking right before Mt. Fuji (the number one mountain) while wearing nothing but her crown, and an apron tied with a sash. (hodgepodge of mspertus, zwarte_kat, et al, with a jot of hadaka apron to focus the image.).
jp_example_words:
一帯(いったい): a region, a zone, the whole place
帯びる(おびる): to wear, to carry, to be entrusted, to have, to take on, to have a trace of, to be tinged with
携帯(けいたい): carrying something
世帯(せたい): household
連帯(れんたい): solidarity
帯(おび): kimono sash
温帯(おんたい): temperate zone
寒帯(かんたい): frigid zone
地帯(ちたい): area, zone
熱帯(ねったい): tropics
包帯(ほうたい): bandage, dressing
jp_readingExamples: 帯びる (お.びる), 帯 (おび)
WaniKani_Radicals: 山, 一, 冖, 巾
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There's a mountain coming out of the ground that you want to climb, but your forehead needs a towel for all your sweat. You don't have a towel, so you take off your belt and tie it around your forehead.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: The belt is easy to tighten and it catches all the sweat before it can fall into your eyes. It isn't quite as absorbent as a towel though.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The belt isn't absorbent enough, so you wrap it in your tie (たい) and then tie the whole thing around your forehead again.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: It works! Your belt tied in a tie is the perfect invention!
Kanshudo_mnemonic: thirty (丗) covered (冖) turbans (巾) 'tai'd' with a belt

帯字的基本解释

帯
dài
古同“帶”。

帯字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dài］
同“帶1”。
《宋元以来俗字谱》：“帶”，《太平乐府》、《东牕记》、《目连记》、《金瓶梅》、《岭南逸事》作“帯”。按，亦为“帶”的日本用简体汉字。

暂无。

Name meaning

dài
яп. вм. 带
Radicals: 山, 一, 冖, 巾  (mountain, ground, forehead, towel)
Meaning Mnemonic
There's a mountain coming out of the ground that you want to climb, but your forehead needs a towel for all your sweat. You don't have a towel, so you take off your belt and tie it around your forehead.
The belt is easy to tighten and it catches all the sweat before it can fall into your eyes. It isn't quite as absorbent as a towel though.
Reading Mnemonic
The belt isn't absorbent enough, so you wrap it in your tie (たい) and then tie the whole thing around your forehead again.
It works! Your belt tied in a tie is the perfect invention!
